image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Michigan; born in Massena, St. Lawrence County, N.Y., October 17, 1846; attended the common schools; Twenty-first Regiment, Michigan Volunteer Infantry, 1864-1865; manufactured wagons and sleighs; member of the board of education of Grand Rapids, Mich., 1871-1878; served on the board of aldermen, Grand Rapids, Mich., 1880-1882; mayor of Grand Rapids, Mich., 1884; hospital executive; elected as a Republican to the Fifty-first Congress (March 4, 1889-March 3, 1891); was not a candidate for renomination to the Fifty-second Congress in 1890; elected to the Fifty-second Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative Melbourne H. Ford (November 3, 1891-March 3, 1893); unsuccessfully contested the election to the Fifty-third Congress; staff duty at Fort Oglethorpe during the Spanish-American War; died on January 16, 1929, in Grand Rapids, Mich.; interment in the Greenwood Cemetery.

note.content: Elected to fill vacancy caused by death of Melbourne H. Ford, and took his seat December 7, 1891.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Belknap, Charles Eugene. Bentonville: what a bummer knows about it. Prepared by Companion Brevet Major Charles E. Belknap ... read at the stated meeting of January 4, 1893. [Washington: N.p., 1893].
------. History of the Michigan organizations at Chickamauga, Chattanooga and Missionary Ridge, 1863. Lansing, Mich.: R. Smith printing co., 1897.
------. The legend of the trailing arbutus. [Grand Rapids: The Dean-Hicks press, 1924].
------. Recollections of a bummer. Prepared by companion Major Charles E. Belknap ... and read at the stated meeting of January 5, 1898. [Washington: N.p., 1898].
------. The yesterdays of Grand Rapids. Grand Rapids: The Dean-Hicks company, 1922.

researchRecord.name: In the McCreery-Fenton Family Papers, 1818-1948, 12 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: Other authors include Charles Eugene Belknap. A finding aid is available in the library and online.

researchRecord.name: In the George E. Luther Collection, 1886-1935, 3 folders.
researchRecord.description: Persons represented include Charles Eugene Belknap.
